author: Ben Cohen
title: The Basketball Game That Became a Stalemate
text:
It was only a good high-school basketball game before it became the most incredible game you’ve never heard about.
Hopkins vs. Shakopee in the Minnesota state tournament four years ago was an absurd epic of basketball strategy pushed to its limits. It was a game in which literally nothing happened for almost 14 of the last 18 minutes in a game that went to four overtimes—and it was because each team had an edge it was willing to take to the extreme.
...
